title: Ex-Prosecutors Denounce Trump’s Attacks on Manhattan DA Bragg
description: A group of more than 175 former federal prosecutors released an open letter denouncing Donald Trump’s incendiary attacks on Manhattan District Attorney Alvin Bragg, who’s investigating the former president for hush-money payments to a porn star.

title: North Korea Fires Ballistic Missile to Pile More Pressure on US
description: North Korea test-fired a suspected ballistic missile, adding to its barrage of launches in the past several weeks that included two rockets designed to deliver a nuclear warhead to the US mainland.

title: Israel’s Netanyahu Fires Defense Minister Over Judicial Plan
description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu dismissed Defense Minister Yoav Gallant after he urged the government to freeze a contentious judicial overhaul, the prime minister’s office announced on Sunday.

title: Nigeria Dispenses Banknotes to End Three-Month Cash Crunch
description: Nigeria’s central bank beefed up the supply of banknotes to lenders to end shortages that have hampered individual and business transactions and crippled the cash-based economy since January.

title: Peru Congress to Discuss Motion to Impeach Boluarte: Republica
description: Peru’s Congress will decide on March 30 whether to accept a motion to discuss the impeachment of President Dina Boluarte, a sign that the country’s political crisis is far from over.

title: Netanyahu’s Court Plan Is on Track Despite Defense Chief Dissent
description: A contentious plan to reduce the power of Israel’s Supreme Court appeared on track for passage this week despite a dramatic speech Saturday night by Defense Minister Yoav Gallant calling for a freeze to the overhaul in the name of national security.

title: UK Economy 4% Smaller Because of Brexit, OBR’s Hughes Says
description: Leaving the European Union had an impact on the UK economy equivalent to the coronavirus pandemic and likely reduced output by 4%, the chairman of the Office for Budget Responsibility told the BBC.

title: Argentina’s Macri Rules Out Making Another Run for President
description: Former Argentine President Mauricio Macri ruled out becoming a candidate in this year’s election, clearing the way for a primary race between leaders within his coalition.

title: House Democrat Ro Khanna Says He Won’t Run for US Senate
description: Representative Ro Khanna said he won’t run for the US Senate seat in California that’s opening up in 2024 and backed fellow progressive Democrat Barbara Lee.

title: Croke Park and Casement Park Included in UK and Ireland Euro 2028 Bid
description: The GAA has granted permission for Croke Park and Casement Park to be included in the UK and Ireland Euro 2028 bid.

title: Ukraine Wants UN Security Council Meeting On Putin Nuclear Plan
description: Kyiv demanded an extraordinary meeting of the UN Security Council to discuss Russia’s intention to station tactical nuclear weapons in Belarus.

title: Biden’s Pick to Head FAA Withdraws After Senate Panel Stalemate
description: President Joe Biden’s nominee to head the Federal Aviation Administration withdrew from consideration in the face of Republican opposition in the Senate, Transportation Secretary Pete Buttigieg said.

title: Daylight savings dispute leaves Lebanon with two time zones
description: BEIRUT (AP) — The Lebanese government’s last-minute decision to delay the start of daylight savings time by a month until the end of the Muslim holy month of Ramadan resulted in mass confusion Sunday.

title: Biden Approves Mississippi Disaster Declaration After Storms
description: President Joe Biden declared that a major disaster exists in Mississippi and ordered federal aid to supplement state, tribal, and local recovery efforts in the areas affected by severe storms on March 24 and March 25, the White House said in statement.

title: Ukraine Latest: US Says Not Planning to Adjust Nuclear Posture
description: Vladimir Putin said Russia is preparing to station tactical nuclear weapons in Belarus, escalating a confrontation with the US and its allies. The Russian president said storing the weapons there won’t breach its non-proliferation obligations. The US will monitor the implications of Putin’s move, the White House’s National Security Council said.

title: Scotland’s New Leader Faces Same Old Rancor Over Independence
description: The country might want to move on, but Nicola Sturgeon’s successor won’t end the division anytime soon.

title: Want Flies With That? EU Critics Have a New Conspiracy Theory
description: Some populist politicians say Brussels is now targeting traditional diets.

title: Scholz Under Pressure to Bring Fractious Coalition Into Line
description: Germany’s ruling coalition is meeting Sunday in Berlin to try to move beyond bickering over issues including climate protection and next year’s budget and dispel the impression that it’s a spent force after only 15 months in power.

title: Taiwan Loses Ally of Eight Decades as Honduras Recognizes China
description: Taiwan and Honduras ended more than eight decades of diplomatic relations as the central American country said it now recognizes the island as part of China.

title: Defiant Trump at Texas Rally Predicts He’ll Survive Probes
description: A defiant Donald Trump railed against the investigations he faces and predicted he’d prevail during a rally in Waco, Texas, that may be the former president’s last public appearance before he faces potential criminal charges.
